alert.note: Alert for Cass; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 9:35PM CDT until April 15 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT FOR FREMONT...SOUTHERN MILLS...NORTHEASTERN OTOE AND SOUTHEASTERN CASS COUNTIES... At 934 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pacific Junction to 3 miles south of Tabor to 2 miles southwest of Riverton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 910 PM, this storm overturned a semi near Peru.. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Farragut, Randolph, Malvern, Shenandoah and Hastings. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
